thread.title: Southern Illinois beats Youngstown State in overtime, 38-31
thread.title_full: Southern Illinois beats Youngstown State in overtime, 38-31

title: Southern Illinois beats Youngstown State in overtime, 38-31
text:
Mark Iannotti throws 3 TD passes, Southern Illinois beats Youngstown State in overtime 38-31 THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   10:55   10:55   
Subjects: 
Illinois (1014) 

CARBONDALE, Illinois — Mark Iannotti threw for 275 yards with three touchdown passes — including the game-winner in overtime — to help Southern Illinois beat Youngstown State 38-31 on Saturday. 
Iannotti found Israel Lamprakes for a 24-yard touchdown on the first possession of overtime. Youngstown State (3-4, 1-3 Missouri Valley) went for it on fourth on the subsequent series, but Jody Webb's halfback option pass fell incomplete out of the side of the end zone. 
A partial punt block late in the fourth by Chase Allen led to Southern Illinois' Austin Johnson kicking a game-tying 18-yard field goal to force overtime with 6 seconds left. 
Earlier in the fourth, Iannotti hooked up with Daquan Isom for a 75-yard catch-and-run touchdown to pull within 5, and the 2-point conversion made it a 3-point game. The Penguins went three-and-out, leading to the partial block. 
Southern Illinois moved to 3-4, 2-2.
